content: Hey, so I am starting with parser library-ification task for real ( :grimacing: ). I think it maybe makes sense to start a working group for this? Specifically, I think it makes sense to have a zulip stream (and not just a topic) under t-compiler.
The deliverable would be "rust-analyzer & rustc are using the same parser". It's a clear goal, though I am less sure about it being "finite" :)
@pnkfelix (as I see that you like the idea) could maybe just go ahead and create the Zulip stream? I'd like to use it right now :D

@matklad I believe for making a project group the procedure is to file an major change proposal on the compiler team repository first. https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team/issues/new?assignees=&labels=major-change%2C+T-compiler&template=major_change.md&title=%28My+major+change+proposal%29
Hm, this is not specified in https://rust-lang.github.io/compiler-team/procedures/form-new-working-group/ ?
@matklad Unfortunately I believe that's old documentation. All the procedure docs moved forge awhile ago. https://forge.rust-lang.org/compiler/mcp.html
Which part of the docs is obsolete? All of them, or only specifc bits about WG? I'd like to remove them from the Internet :)
Filed https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team/issues/338!
@matklad Well I think it's just using old terminology and doesn't mention that you should file an MCP.
I've seen the RFC process recently used to propose project groups
I'm honestly not immediately certain whether we prefer RFC or MCP for this
though one would think that RFC process is overkill for it
I think T-compiler project groups don't really need RFCs as much as T-lang might
project groups themselves are described in RFC 2856; that document may specify how the groups get formed...
and even for lang I'm not really feeling that they're hugely necessary
Yeah I'm not sure even MCP is necessary, according to RFC 2856, as long as you have a lead and a liason established

Ah there is a bullet in the future work section of rfc#2856 that talks about why one would and wouldn't want to use the RFC process to obtain consensus about forming groups before actually forming them
okay yes, there is supposed to be team consensus to form a project group
and that is why at least an MCP is necessary
I think MCP is appropriate
for the reasons above -- good way to get team consensus, but not really something where "community wide" consensus is appropriate/required
or at least, community wide input

sooo, does anyone wantsto second the proposal https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team/issues/338 ? ^^

Not sure I undestand the process fully, but at the moment it seems blocked on the absense of second?
Maybe @Vadim Petrochenkov?
Who would be part of this working group?

@matklad mostly I would think -- the grouping here is most valuable in terms of "work" rather than collective of people doing that.

I am not sure this work is easily parallelisable, at least until the design is fully clear :(
IIRC what’s important when forming a WG are the leaders?
@matklad maybe the people in the Discord group #wg-grammar could be interested? I know @eddyb did a lot of grammar and parsing work, with some other people like @qmx and others I can't find in Zulip.
oooh this sounds awesome!!!
/me has been AWOL due to new job onboarding
